alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 4:34AM MST until March 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Sedona affecting Coconino and Yavapai Counties. For Oak Creek near Sedona...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Sedona. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Multiple private low water crossings and bridges over Oak Creek above Sedona become impassable. At 13.0 feet, Stream reaches terrace near Tlaquepaque bridge. Water reaches edge of several residential and commercial properties near Tlaquepaque bridge. Low water crossings closed. At 14.0 feet, Flood stage. Several islands downstream in Sedona evacuated. Minor flooding of access roads, buildings, and residences along Oak Creek. At 16.0 feet, Minor damage to shops and galleries near the Tlaquepaque bridge. At 18.0 feet, Inundation begins at Rancho Sedona RV Park on Bear Wallow Lane as well as lower parking lot of Poco Diablo Resort off of Oak Creek Cliffs Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM MST Wednesday /5:15 AM MDT Wednesday/ the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise this morning to a crest of 12.5 feet, then begin to fall through the afternoon and evening. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Oak Creek Sedona 14.0 11.3 Wed 4 am MST 5.9 4.6 4.3 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
